description: From Middle English weke-day, from Old English wicdæġ. Equivalent to week +‎ day. Compare West Frisian wikedei (“weekday”), Dutch weekdag (“weekday”), German Wochentag (“weekday”), Danish ugedag (“weekday”), Swedish veckodag (“weekday”), Norwegian ukedag (“weekday”).

definitionGroups.group: Any individual day of the week, except those which form the weekend or the single weekly day off; that is:

entries.meaning: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday, but not Saturday or Sunday.
(Islam) Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, but not Friday.
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, or Saturday, but not Sunday. (e.g. in Vietnam)
(Judaism) Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday, but not Saturday.
(now rare) Any day of the week (Monday through Sunday).
